page.title: 09BUILDINGS
page.content: THORNHILL.:_Now a private, residential estate served by two schools,St. Clare's and our school Acklam Whin, which was opened in 1970.The site was originally farmland but the only existing farm is Stainsby Hall Farm,adjacent to Thornhill estate. STAINTON.:_Situated on the approach road to this small,old village are two new buildings,Stainton Telephone Exchange and the Post House Hotel.The old school sited next to the village pub,The Stainton,is now used as offices.The Memorial Hall,near the old Wesleyan Chapel is used as a community centre.The beautiful old parish church opposite the vicarage is built on the site of the original twelfth century church. THORNTON.:_Mainly farmland,Whitewing Poultry Farm the largest.A mixture of old and new housing.
